title: Regressions spotted by Debian CI in curl 8.13-rc1
body:
### I did this

We have uploaded 8.13-rc1 to experimental so all reverse-dependencies could run their test-suites against the release candidate and we could spot regressions early on. Besides the already reported and fixed (thanks!) [regression in trurl's test suite](https://ci.debian.net/packages/t/trurl/unstable/amd64/58631222/#L398), we are seeing 2 more regressions. [One in liboauth2's test suite](https://ci.debian.net/packages/libo/liboauth2/unstable/amd64/58601477/#L1107) and [another one in pycurl's test suite](https://ci.debian.net/packages/p/pycurl/unstable/amd64/58601553/#L1261).

## Pycurl's regression

Digging a bit deeper in pycurl's tests, I get the following trace:

```
self = <tests.getinfo_test.GetinfoTest testMethod=test_getinfo_cookie_invalid_utf8_python3>

    @util.only_python3
    def test_getinfo_cookie_invalid_utf8_python3(self):
        self.curl.setopt(self.curl.COOKIELIST, '')
        self.make_request('/set_cookie_invalid_utf8', 'cookie set')

        self.assertEqual(200, self.curl.getinfo(pycurl.HTTP_CODE))

        info = self.curl.getinfo(pycurl.INFO_COOKIELIST)
>       domain, incl_subdomains, path, secure, expires, name, value = info[0].split("\t")
E       IndexError: list index out of range

info       = []
self       = <tests.getinfo_test.GetinfoTest testMethod=test_getinfo_cookie_invalid_utf8_python3>

tests/getinfo_test.py:90: IndexError
```

Could it be a regression from 1aea05a6c2699e80c75936d58569851555acd603, 597ee915c4c6da132dbd1735345b4fa511fde6f6 or 0064708f3f1879e0982f5486ebae25e28bee27d8? Or could it be a problem in pycurl's test suite and I should report it to pycurl directly?

## Liboauth2's Regression

During liboauth2 test suite execution, failures happened and looking at the logs the following lines caught my attention:

```
[src/http.c:1100:oauth2_http_call:ERR] curl_easy_perform() failed on: http://127.0.0.1:8080/test/check_jose/jwks_uri (Unsupported protocol: Unsupported HTTP/1 subversion in response)
```

### I expected the following

No failures in reverse-dependencies at all :-)

### curl/libcurl version

curl 8.13.0-rc1 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.13.0-rc1 GnuTLS/3.8.9 zlib/1.3.1 brotli/1.1.0 zstd/1.5.6 libidn2/2.3.8 libpsl/0.21.2 libssh2/1.11.1 nghttp2/1.64.0 ngtcp2/1.11.0 nghttp3/1.8.0 librtmp/2.3 OpenLDAP/2.6.9
Release-Date: 2025-03-08, security patched: 8.13.0~rc-1~exp2
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ipfs ipns ldap ldaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtmp rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp ws wss
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli GSS-API HSTS HTTP2 HTTP3 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile libz NTLM PSL SPNEGO SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd


### operating system

Debian experimental

Linux x1-carbon 6.12.12-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.12.12-1 (2025-02-02) x86_64 GNU/Linux
